info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:46PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Transylvania, northwestern Pickens and northeastern Oconee Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 146 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles north of Walhalla, or near Devils Fork State Park, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salem, Devils Fork State Park, Lake Keowee, Gorges State Park, Keowee Toxaway State Park, Jocassee Gorges, Lake Jocassee, Sunset, Bad Creek and Nine Times. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
